item.title: PSA: You shouldn’t upload your medical images to AI chatbots
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
Security and privacy advocates have long warned that sensitive medical data can be used to train AI models, and can expose personal data down the line.

item.title: Kim Kardashian has befriended Optimus, the Tesla bot
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
Pete Davidson? Kanye West? Step aside. Kim Kardashian’s new beaux is a Tesla bot named Optimus. The fashion mogul got some hands-on experience with Tesla’s bipedal, human-shaped robot, which is not yet available to the general public. In Kardashian’s videos with the robot — posted to X and her Instagram story — she prompts Optimus […]

item.title: VW taps former Rivian exec to run US business
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Volkswagen of America has a new CEO: Rivian’s recently departed chief commercial officer Kjell Gruner. The appointment comes just one week after VW parent company Volkswagen Group formalized a $5.8 billion joint venture with Rivian, which will be focused on EV architecture and software. While Gruner’s new post isn’t really related to that new JV, […]

item.title: Chroma, backed by Pinterest and Twitter cofounders, sells to AI audio company Bronze
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Chroma, a startup building a new type of audiovisual entertainment for mobile devices, has been sold. The company, which had financial backing from Twitter and Medium co-founder Biz Stone as well as Pinterest co-founder Evan Sharp, is headed to London-based audio technology company Bronze, an AI music startup. Founded by record producer Lex Dromgoole, who’s […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Meta hires Salesforce’s CEO of AI, Clara Shih, to lead new business AI group
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
Meta hired Salesforce’s CEO of AI, Clara Shih, to lead a new organization building AI tools for businesses that use Meta’s apps to reach consumers, according to a LinkedIn post from Shih on Tuesday. Meta confirmed the appointment and the new Business AI group in a statement to TechCrunch. “I’m thrilled to share today that […]

item.title: Nuclear startups face new competition as energy giant Enel enters the ring
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
The new endeavor could put additional pressure on small modular reactor (SMR) startups that have struggled to build power plants.

item.title: OpenAI brings ChatGPT’s Advanced Voice Mode to the web
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description:
OpenAI is expanding ChatGPT’s Advanced Voice Mode feature to the web, letting users talk to the AI chatbot right from their browser. The company’s chief product officer, Kevin Weil, announced the launch on X. The feature, which makes ChatGPT more natural to speak with, is rolling out to ChatGPT’s paying customers this week, which means […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google ships first developer preview Android 16 to speed up feature roll outs
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Google is releasing the first developer preview of Android 16 to speed up feature rollouts in devices. This is a major change in the Android rollout schedule as, over the past few years, Google released its first Android developer beta around Q2, with a stable release coming out post-July. With the new schedule, Android 16’s […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Las Vegas Sheriff tells a16z partners what’s next on his wish list: AI for bodycams
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane, Margaux MacColl
item.description:
Vegas police received funding for tech like drones and license plate readers from Ben Horowitz. Now it wants AI to go through police footage.

item.title: Thanks, Netflix, but we don’t need another daily word game
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Netflix is adding a new title to its gaming library: a daily word puzzle that is eerily similar to a lot of other mobile games that exist already.  Announced in October, the streaming giant teamed up with TED, the well-known non-profit media organization, to launch TED Tumblewords, a new daily word puzzle game. In this […]

item.title: GitHub launches $1.25M open source fund with a focus on security
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
The open source funding problem is very real, but a slew of initiatives have emerged of late, with startups, corporations, and venture capitalists launching various programs to support some of the most critical projects via equity-free financing. Today it’s GitHub’s turn, launching the GitHub Secure Open Source Fund with an initial commitment of $1.25 million […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Google’s Gemini chatbot now has memory
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Google’s Gemini chatbot can now remember things like info about your life, work, and personal preferences. As flagged by posters on X (and Google’s official account), a “memory” feature has begun rolling out to certain Gemini users, including this reporter. Like ChatGPT’s memory, Gemini’s adds context to the current conversation. For example, tell Gemini to […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Mitsubishi backs Ample’s radical approach to charging EV batteries
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Startup Ample is on a mission to convert commercial fleets into believers in the power of electric vehicle battery swapping technology.   The company has spent the last three years piloting its electric vehicle battery swapping technology in San Francisco, Madrid, and Japan. Now, Ample is preparing to turn some of those pilot customers into commercial […]

item.title: What is Bluesky? Everything to know about the X competitor
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description:
Is the grass greener on the other side? We’re not sure, but the sky is most certainly bluer. It’s been two years since Elon Musk purchased Twitter, now X, leading people to set up shop on alternative platforms. Mastodon, Post, Pebble (two of which have already shuttered operations) and Spill have been presented as potential […]

item.title: Codecrafters wants to challenge seasoned developers with hard-to-build projects
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
There are plenty of online platforms for developers that help you learn new skills or get started with a new language, such as CodeCademy, Leetcode, and CodeSignal. Some guide developers step by step through the process while teaching the basics, while others provide detailed video tutorials. Codecrafters is a platform that doesn’t want to show […]

item.title: IRL social app Pie is coming to SF to make you less lonely
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description:
After a robust career building Bonobos and advocating for founder mental health, Andy Dunn moved to Chicago with his family. A few years later, he came to a depressing realization: He hadn’t made any new friends. “I don’t think it’s easy to admit to yourself that you don’t have friends,” Dunn told TechCrunch, laughing. “It’s […]

item.title: YC-backed Formal brings a clever security reverse-proxy out of stealth
item.dc:creator: Romain Dillet
item.description:
Formal is a security startup coming out of stealth on Tuesday with a nice list of investors and an interesting product positioning. The company has designed a reverse-proxy for data stores and APIs so that security teams can more easily secure access to sensitive data. In more practical terms, Formal is a proxy that you […]

item.title: Bluesky tops 20M users, narrowing gap with Instagram Threads
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description:
Bluesky, the social network and X competitor, has been benefiting from a surge of departures from the Elon Musk-owned app formerly known as Twitter. Today, Bluesky has hit a major milestone: it’s topped 20 million users. What’s more, new data indicates the app’s rapid growth is seeing it close the gap with another prominent X […]

item.title: Physical AI startup BrightAI bootstraps to $80M in revenue
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
When Alex Hawkinson was the CEO of SmartThings, the consumer-focused connected devices company he co-founded and sold to Samsung for around $200 million, he kept thinking that Internet of Things (IoT) technology could probably solve bigger issues. He left SmartThings in 2018 to figure out where connected devices could make the largest impact. He co-founded […]

item.title: Minecraft is entering the real world
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Minecraft is entering the real world — sort of. The Guardian reports that Microsoft, the owner of the Minecraft video game franchise, has struck a deal with European theme park operator Merlin Entertainments to open Minecraft-themed attractions, including rides, retail outlets, and hotel rooms. Merlin plans to invest more than $110 million in the first […]
